page.title: 05River Itchen
page.content: The Worthies lie along the course of King's Worthy, Abbot's Worthy, Martyr Worthy and Easton villages.{The River {Itchen}winds and curves its way through a valley of woods and water meadows.It is a small river less than 30 miles long from the tidal estuary at Southampton to the source. It is renowned for trout fishing and the wildlife along the banks. Mr Holloway, the water bailiff, tells stories of a pair of breeding otters but will not disclose their holt. The river is spring fed. Extensive areas of the river at Martyr Worthy were converted to{water meadows.}Water was led into carriers and allowed to overflow to the drains. Farmers could divert water on to grass during the winter to provide early grazing for sheep.Much of the system can still be seen.
